scenes.text: Docker is a platform that enables developers to easily deploy applications inside containers. Containers are lightweight, standalone, executable packages that contain all the required components such as code, runtime, system tools, libraries, and settings for an application to run consistently across different computing environments. This consistency makes Docker highly valuable in mitigating the classic issue of software working on one system but not another due to environmental differences.
scenes.image_prompt:
# Docker Overview

```mermaid
flowchart TB
    A[Docker Client] --> B[Docker Daemon]
    B --> C{Docker Containers}
    C --> D[App 1]
    C --> E[App 2]
    B --> F((Docker Hub))
    F --> B
```

### Key Components:

| Component | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Docker Client | Sends commands to the Docker Daemon |
| Docker Daemon | Builds, runs, and manages Docker containers |
| Containers | Isolated environments for applications |
| Docker Hub | Repository for Docker images |

- Docker allows consistent application deployment.
- It packages applications with all dependencies.
- Docker containers run on any machine regardless of the environment.
